wikipedia_page.main: Sir Cyril Norman Hinshelwood  (19 June 1897 – 9 October 1967) was a British physical chemist and a Nobel Prize laureate.

response: A quantitative chain chemical reaction theory was created later on by Soviet physicist Nikolay Semyonov in 1934. Semyonov shared the Nobel Prize in 1956 with Sir Cyril Norman Hinshelwood, who independently developed many of the same quantitative concepts.http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/1956/press.html History of the chemical chain reaction from 1913 to the Nobel work recognized in 1956
*1897 – Cyril Norman Hinshelwood, English chemist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (d. 1967)
*  1967   – Cyril Norman Hinshelwood, English chemist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (b. 1897)
